It is a [[graduate school]] focused on [[Administration (business)|business administration]], and should not be confused with the University's [[undergraduate]] [[Gabelli School of Business]]. The main campus for the graduate school is located in the [[New York City]] [[borough (New York City)|borough]] of [[Manhattan]]. Fordham University's involvement in business started early in the 20th century with the founding of the undergraduate College of Business in 1920. The Graduate School of Business opened in 1969 as part of the redevelopment of [[Lincoln Center]].As I Remember Fordham, 1991. Pg 1-3. According to [[BusinessWeek]]'s MBA Profile, between the New York City and Westchester campuses, the school has 349 full-time students and 1,202 part-time students.[http://www.businessweek.com/bschools/rankings/part_time_mba_profiles/fordham.html BusinessWeek profile] == Rankings == The school was ranked 27th in both the 2006 and 2007 rankings of regional schools conducted by ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' / [[Harris Interactive]], based on its annual survey of corporate recruiters.[http://online.wsj.com/public/resources/documents/MB_07_Scoreboard.pdf Where the Schools Rank], ''[[Wall Street Journal]]''. Accessed January 3, 2008. In 2008, The Wall Street Journal ranked Fordham Executive MBA in Top 30. http://www.bnet.fordham.edu/about-fordham-business/rankings-summary/index.htm The Graduate School of Business is also part of a consortium offering an MBA at Peking University in Beijing, China. This program, known as BiMBA (Beijing international MBA), is listed by Forbes Magazine as one of the most valuable Chinese programs.[http://www.deanstalk.net/deanstalk/2007/04/forbes_best_bus.html BizDeans Talk web article] == Academics == Within the Master of Business Administration (MBA) program, concentrations are offered in Accounting, Communications and Media Management, Finance and Business Economics, Information Systems, Management Systems, Marketing, Public Accounting and Taxation/Accounting (MTA Program). Within the Master of Science (MS) programs, degrees are awarded in Communications and Media Management, Information Systems, Taxation, Accounting, and Quantitative Finance.
